questions.stem: Where should footnote numbers be placed in text?
questions.rationale: Footnote numbers come after punctuation marks, typically at the end of sentences.

questions.stem: How should footnote numbers appear in text?
questions.rationale: Footnote numbers should be superscript in the text.

questions.stem: Where do footnotes appear on the page?

options.label: At the top of the page
At the bottom of the page
At the end of the document

questions.rationale: Footnotes appear at the bottom (foot) of the same page as the reference.

questions.stem: How do endnotes differ from footnotes?

options.label: Endnotes appear at the end of chapters or documents

questions.rationale: Endnotes are gathered at the end of chapters or documents, not at page bottoms.

questions.stem: When might you choose endnotes over footnotes?

options.label: When you have many long notes

questions.rationale: Endnotes prevent page bottoms from being overwhelmed by long or numerous notes.

questions.stem: Endnotes typically appear under the heading _____ at chapter or document end.
questions.rationale: Endnotes are usually gathered under a 'Notes' heading.

questions.stem: What is the standard order for bibliography entries?

options.label: By order of appearance in text

questions.rationale: Bibliography entries are typically arranged alphabetically by author's surname.

questions.stem: How should book titles appear in bibliographies?
questions.rationale: Book titles are italicized in bibliographic entries.

questions.stem: Order the parts of a book bibliography entry:
questions.rationale: Standard bibliography format for books follows this order.

questions.stem: What is the purpose of citations?

options.label: To give credit and allow verification

questions.rationale: Citations give credit to sources and allow readers to verify information.

questions.stem: What should be cited? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Cite any information taken from other sources, whether quoted or paraphrased.

questions.stem: Which citation style is commonly used in Canadian government documents?
questions.rationale: Citation style varies by department and document type; follow organizational guidelines.

questions.stem: What additional information is needed for electronic source citations?
questions.rationale: Electronic sources need access dates because online content can change.

questions.stem: How should URLs be formatted in citations?
questions.rationale: URLs are typically formatted as plain text in citations.

questions.stem: Electronic sources should include: Author, Title, URL, and _____.
questions.rationale: Access date is crucial for electronic sources because content can change.

questions.stem: Click on the missing element in this citation:
questions.rationale: Missing access date, which is required for electronic sources.
